Reviews.Title: It's a keeper
Reviews.Author: Angie Pie
Reviews.Content: I got rid of my Fujifilm z10fd (7.2 MP) after being sick and tired of grainy pictures, even in brightly lit, outdoor conditions. Previous to that camera, I owned a Sony Cybershot DSC-S40, which was 4.1 MP camera that took fantastic pictures. I did a lot of research on dozens of point-and-shoots and I settled on this one for its affordable price, zoom range, and special features. Plus, I was really happy with my S40, so I was pretty confident with my decision to go with Sony.Overall, I am very pleased with this camera's performance. Initially I was a bit disappointed, but I attribute that to playing around with a lot of DSLRs recently, and obviously there is no way that this DSC-H55 can match those in picture quality. Nevertheless, this camera has a lot of strong points that make it a great buy. Its best feature is its 10x optical zoom. At full zoom, you can still see the minutest details. The sweep panorama feature is a ton of fun to use. Performance in well-lit conditions are excellent, and the flash is powerful enough to illuminate a room when lighting is not sufficient. I am also very happy with the manual controls that Sony gives me. Becoming familiar with this is going to be very rewarding when it comes time to shoot in low-light conditions.Sony's menu is intuitive and easy to use. Image stabilization works very well, the percentage of blurry pictures that come out is negligible. Also, red-eye isn't too bad on this camera. Every single picture I took with my fujifilm came out with a red-eye, which was extremely irritating. Boy am I happy those days are over. The smile shutter feature is fun to experiment with. Not really a necessity, but most of my friends who have snatched this camera out of my hands have been in awe.Lastly, the camera itself looks great. The silver color looks sleek, and its size is fairly small for the power and features it includes. Not as tiny as the Sony W series cameras or the compact Canon powershots out there, but it is certainly pocketable. It also very lightweight considering its size.A few minor gripes: Even though this camera uses the Sony G lens, I was really hoping that it was made with a Carl Zeiss lens instead. G lenses are used on Sony's alpha DSLR cameras, so this does not bother me too much. Also, it would be great to have an optical viewfinder. But what new digital camera has those nowadays...Those minor annoyances are not enough to make me return this camera. I am very pleased with its performance.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Eric Holand
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. The panorama feature is really neat. I took this camera with me to Chicago a week after purchase. With the panorama shot I was able to sweep the camera in a fluid motion to capture a pic of the whole city and with the megapixel load able to blow it up to a very good size with no blocked finish. The zoom on this thing is great, even from the top of the Sears Tower I was able to zoom in and take shot clear across town with great clarity. The pics themselves as long as you let it do its thing and focus come out crystal clear. This camera lights up any situation when needed with ease, very brightn flash. This camera isnt to bulky, I had no problem carring it when my wife need to lighten up the load in her purse for a bit. The video is really sharp it shoots HD video and is clear. One thing I wish it had was a HDMI port for direct play on a television but once downloaded to a hard drive and replayed it comes out HD quality. The steady shot works well. It is a nice piece of equipent for the price and takes really great photos. If in auto focus it takes a few seconds to par up so you have to wait to let it do its thing once adjusted the photos are professional quality.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55
Reviews.Author: Bradd Alan Dantuma
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera....bought it just in time for a trip to Yellowstone National Park & the pictures were incredible. Video is a bit grainy & when moving too quick while taking a video it tends to blur. Overall though its a fantastic camera, easy to learn, easy to use, the panorama sweep feature is fun. The feature i was most impressed with was the double shot feature, it saved many of shots that otherwise would have been blurry or dark.

Reviews.Title: zoom-zoom
Reviews.Author: spacecadet333 "V."
Reviews.Content: The Sony DSC-H55 is an amazing little camera with great zooming capabilities.  The first pictures I took were high school graduation pictures.  I wasn't even that close to the action but when I uploaded the pictures onto the computer and saw them on a bigger screen, I was amazed to see just how clear the pictures were. It was as if I was standing right there w/ the graduates.  I have also taken the camera on my trips to Disneyland and California Adventure and the photos were quite stunning.  I had the Disney photos printed at my local Costco and I am so happy with the results.This is my fourth digital camera (my previous cameras were 2 Sonys and 1 Canon) but it's the first with optical image stabilization and so far I don't know how I ever lived without it.  I think out of the hundreds of shots that I have taken I can count the total of blurred shots on one hand.I would have given it 5 stars except for one minor detail.  The battery/memory card compartment cover bugs the heck out of me.  I don't think I've ever seen a cheaper plastic used as a cover before.  Every time I want to take out the card or the battery to be charged, I have to be careful to not put too much pressure on the darn thing.  It looks like it could easily break off.  The last thing I want is to have to tape the cover down w/ duct tape.  Let's hope it will never have to come to that!Despite the cover issue,I am quite satisfied with camera.  My trip to Hawaii is in 3 weeks I am looking forward to many more wonderful shots taken with the Sony DSC-H55.

Reviews.Title: Packed with features
Reviews.Author: travelmaxwk
Reviews.Content: So far the h55 is great.  The image stabilization helps with those not-so-calm days and the panoramic setting is great for those landscape or group shots.I suggest you get the kit with added memory.  The camera will only take 8 photos at the 14.1M setting with the built-in memory.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed...The picture quality is not good
Reviews.Author: Somasundaram
Reviews.Content: We got this camera(Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55) yesterday (06/24) and after testing it with pictures taken under different lighting conditions, I should say it is disappointing. For some pictures taken outdoors, it fades the natural color of the scenaries. It also washes off photos taken indoors. One another thing is the picture in the View finder(LCD Screen) is grainy. This really irritates on a camera with 14 MP and 10x zoom. It does this even while shooting a object at a normal distance.I already have a Panasonic Lumix ZS7 and this camera Sony DCS-H55 comes no where close to the picture quality.Overall, I won't recommend this camera for this price($199)

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: gmklee
Reviews.Content: Have been waiting for a reasonably-priced small camera with lots of zoom capability to come along, and this is it!  Got it in anticipation of a trip to Europe and found it to be all I was looking for and more! It is heavier than most cameras out there today with similar resolution, but that's because of the great zoom capability and well worth it. The sweep panorama function is fun, but I found that the photos are not the highest quality as some features are disabled in sweep panorama mode. I found the Intelligent Auto setting to be just perfect for me in most situations. Great battery life between charges. I was especially impressed with photos taken in low light, both indoors and out.  All in all, a great little camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo Uplegger
Reviews.Content: I just bought it and I think it is a very good camera for the price. The sweep panorama feature is great and the picture quality is very good. The only negative part is the USB download cable which is a completely different one from the standard that lately I was getting with all my electronics.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, especially for an amateur
Reviews.Author: A Reader
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in September and am thrilled with it.  I've taken the camera on several trips and have taken a gazillion pictures of my cat.  Some of the photos are crystal clear; I've take pictures of my cat where I can literally count cat hairs. I've created a photobook and calendar using photos I took from the camera and was very pleased with the results.  I was able to enlarge some of the pictures using the software that came with the camera without noticing any degradation in quality. Some of the pictures in the photobook were in 8 x 11 format; they are maybe just a little fuzzy in some of the corners, but they look great for my amateur purposes.I have been playing around with the various shooting modes (manual, scenes, easy, etc.) and am pleased that, for the most part, the pictures come out best when the camera is in automatic mode.  As an amateur who wants to be able to take good pictures without having to know a lot about ISO settings, etc., this is a relief.The 10x optical zoom is great.  I love the smile shutter feature; I was skeptical but it really works. I also love the sweep panarama feature, although I haven't tried printing any of these shots.  The burst setting and the action scene setting are also fun.  The focus lock has also come in handy a lot.I can attest that the camera can withstand a drop of three feet onto pavement; the shell is a little nicked up but it hasn't impacted the pictures.  I'll be using the wrist strap from now on, however.A couple of minor issues that I've noticed:- You have to really hold the camera steady in low light without the flash. With the flash no problem, but if you are in indirect light, indoors, or twilight, you need the flash or a very steady hand.  It is possible to get a clear picture without the flash; I've done it, but I had to really concentrate on holding still.- Sometimes the camera has trouble figuring out what to focus on. This can sometimes be fixed by reactivating the focus lock, or if that doesn't work, changing the focus mode, but sometimes neither works. This has most often come up when I'm using the zoom feature or in low light.  It isn't enough of a problem to make me unhappy with the camera.- Video is really dark, you need a lot of light to get a good video (especially if you are shooting video of a black cat).I would not hestitate to recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony Triumphs
Reviews.Author: Ian S. Mowat "Tartan Frog"
Reviews.Content: I have a casio Exelim which is 4 years old but has preformed really well.  Time for a change though and the game has moved on.  I chose this camera over other similar models for a number of reasons.  First off Sony have at last embraced SD cards - no deal otherwise.  After that it was the high definition rating, the features and the price.  It is way cheaper than the Panasonic.  I chose the 10X zoom model over the lesser, cheaper Sony models because it has better controls, a better lens and a wider wide angle setting.I just got it today so this is an instant review but a walk around the block in the NY snow and it was easy to snap away and get excellent quality photos.  I deliberately shot into the sun and still got excellent contrast throughout.  I shot faces with a bright background and the balance between face and background was well handled.  I also shot in a similar situation and the auto flash compensated.  Finally I used the panorama mode.  So easy and an excellent, interesting photo resulted.  But it was grainy when blown up to full screen mode.One feature missing is an override on flash to turn it on always.  The auto mode may be enough to compensate.  I am shooting in centre metering mode.  Also available are averaging and spot.  Lots of other manual controls available and full manual mode.So far it is love.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Money!
Reviews.Author: kj1129
Reviews.Content: I knew I had to have this camera the minute I saw it - the photos are crisp and clear. I was tired of using my husband's over-sized, over-priced and complicated camera for family get-togethers, etc. Changing lenses and dragging all of the camera equipment was a real pain. The Sony camera is small enough to carry in my pocket and is extremely easy to use for even the most inexperienced photographer. A great buy!

Reviews.Title: Optical zoom while shooting video!
Reviews.Author: orion "orion"
Reviews.Content: Most cameras don't allow you to use the optical zoom while shooting video. Funny how you don't know this unless you read user reviews. Some let you use the digital zoom which creates blurry images and movies.I did have to send it back to Sony for sensor repairs. All the images were coming out extremely overexposed. They fixed it quick and for free.I like the fact that this particular Sony uses SD cards as well as their Memory Sticks. One of the reasons I never bought a Sony before was their stupid proprietary Memory Sticks.Love the sweep panorama mode!

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing product and value - both it twice!
Reviews.Author: Maggie Mongan, Business Strategist, Brilliant...
Reviews.Content: OK, last year we bought this camera from Best Buy and we were as pleased as could be (it was a first digital camera and we could operate it with great ease)! We bought it for business purposes and the main charity our business sponsors. Being able to take clear pictures and videos for the blog and website is critical for our causes. One of the ways we raise money to support The Highground (a WI Veterans Memorial Park), is to take photos/videos of our Harley riding excursions. So imagine our surprise when it was stolen on one of our trips last year!  We had all sorts of goodies on it that are lost forever. So we bought a comparable camera, and took numerous photos that just didn't turn out well at all. That's why we came back to this one... it can hold a focus exquisitely and the zoom is just out of this world!!! (especially for new digital camera users)This camera captures images just as you see them at the precise moment you snap the image. The screen is crystal clear so you really know what you are capturing. The panoramic feature is great and fun to play with especially with nature shots. The colors are vibrant and it looks as if everything is alive. The video is a high enough quality for small business owners to do videos for websites and YouTube clips. This camera comes with re-chargable batteries (which is so needed these days). Additionally,the software is brilliant- saving and editing your content is much easier to use than others. We loved this camera so much that we searched and waited to make another purchase (after the dud of its replacement- a nonSony camera) until we could find it again. SONY outdid themselves on this one and we are grateful!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot DSC-H55
Reviews.Author: Northwoods Lover
Reviews.Content: The camera is great.  I love all of the features.  It has terrific zoom.  The only negative is that it does not add the date to the photos.  One has to go in & do this manually after the photos are uploaded to the computer, which is a time intensive task.  My older Cybershot imprinted the date on the photos.  Why would the newer model not do the same?

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my use
Reviews.Author: David L. Waters Sr. "Eternal Optimist"
Reviews.Content: Love the features.  Takes crisp photos at full zoom, unlike some earlier models.  I really like the panoramic feature.  Movies are excellent and easily uploadable.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: The camera is as expected. Works well. This model is easy to use and the settings and controls are easy to find and use. I recommend this camera for any one to use. It takes vibrant pictures and will fit in your shirt pocket. The photos are large enough to crop and still get a great photo.

Reviews.Title: Uses outdated cards that can't be easily purchased.
Reviews.Author: Pippin Ninja "pippininja"
Reviews.Content: Uses outdated cards that can't be easily purchased. I'm sorry I bought this. I should have bought a better camera in the first place.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera...
Reviews.Author: Allam P.
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera, good functionality and fulfilled my expectations about the product. Only one word about the presentation, the camera have some scratches that are not important but I would have liked to see that before.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: E. C. Tinker
Reviews.Content: only complaint is how GD sony has their own propriety memory card!  just never ever lose the cable to connect directly to the computer!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: LaurieAnn M
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery, brand new in package, love the camera. I have an iPhone and I know it's supposed to have a great camera- but this Sony CyberShot beats it hands down. Great transaction, great camera. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Great Replacement for Old Cybershot
Reviews.Author: annbluebonnet
Reviews.Content: I had a 10 year old cybershot that I did not want to let go.  I needed a new camera and was very pleased that I was able transition so smoothly to my new one.  Great Price!

Reviews.Title: Camera viewfinder broke just one year after purchase
Reviews.Author: Deanna B. Washington "gardenluver"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera just over a year ago and the view screen has now broken on it twice - fuzzy images, blank white screen, etc. For a purchase price of $200+ and Sony, you expect something to last longer than a year. Thank goodness we bought a square trade warranty with it, but what a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Roxy
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this camera, I love it.... My girlfriend took a few pictures with mine and fell in love with it and went and purchased one for herself.  A great camera, takes wonderful pictures, light, easy to travel with and not hard on batteries at all.  Very user friendly which is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: Camera Screen
Reviews.Author: J.A. Slack
Reviews.Content: I liked it but it didn't last too long.  The screen started getting black corners affecting the photo results.  I always kept the camera in a case and sheltered from the weather.  Too bad because I always bought Sony products and never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: Sony digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Keith "keith"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for the price.Lot's of features, great zoom (10X).Panoramic is so cool!Very pleased.Would recommend this to a friend in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: billbo
Reviews.Content: The screen quality when taking pictures is very poor.  If I new it would be like this I would not have purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Bonnie McPhail
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip abroad.  I wanted something small that produced great images.  I was very pleased with the images and the battery life.  Great Price and great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Kristen Maxfield
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  High resolution and good color.  Wish I could disable viewing picture after every shot for speedier photos.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as my other sony cybershot
Reviews.Author: Snichols
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my mom because I love my sony cybershot that's 2 or 3 years old - the DSC-H10.  While the camera seems to work fine overall, she's had trouble with funny distortions - people's heads seem stretched and such in certain pictures.  I don't know if just this particular camera was flawed or if this is a design flaw.  If I remember right this has a different lens but I didn't think that would be a huge deal, but it might just be.I would not get this product unless you could try it out and easily return it.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Wayne Maden
Reviews.Content: I've had this little camera for about 6 years or more now, and it works very well.  The only problem I've had is I gave this to my wife and she does not keep the battery charged up often enough, so I am now on my third battery for it.  Lithium Ion batteries NEED to be charged OFTEN and NOT run all the way down to where they are dead.  That will drastically shorten the life of them.

Reviews.Title: Total disappointment
Reviews.Author: Patricia H. "Patty"
Reviews.Content: I don't like this camera at all. I chose a Cybershot because I have a good experience with my previous camera, but I don't like this, the quality of the pictures is just poor, at least the ones taken at night. It's not good for close up shots. I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-H55
Reviews.Author: Sachin Khade
Reviews.Content: This is really amazing product from Sony, bought it after lots of R&D;, picture quality is amazing and even the videos  are of HD quality....really amazing camera any fresher can user this camera, just point and shoot....i am loving it...i  bought 2 one for myself and the other for my friend.

Reviews.Title: Is this really a Sony?
Reviews.Author: Pettyfogger
Reviews.Content: I have another Sony that I really like, but it is a little big for carrying around sometimes.  So I had been looking for a small camera that could be easily carried around.  My wife has a Canon, which she likes, but I wanted to get a Sony because of my prior experience.  I am still trying to learn about it.  The easy setting is indeed easy, but can produce some bizzar pictures.  One of the pictures I took with that setting resulted in a flash, on a bright day!  You would think that would only use more battery, however, it resulted in a darker picture than whin I shut off the flash.  Evidently the flash feeds back to the camera even when there is no object for it to reflext off of (the item I was taking a picture of was 30 to 50 feet away).  I shut off the flash and it took a much better picture.  The easy setting at night has a unbearably long wait between when you push the button and when the picture is actually taken.  The manual setting has only two f-stops: 3.5 and 8.  The shutter speed, however is great.  It ranges from 1/1600 to 30 seconds! (yes, 30, thirty seconds)  There is the EASY setting, that I already discussed, then the "Intelligent Auto adjustment" which allows you to add to the EASY settings and make changes to exposure,face detection, smile detection (which basically doesn't work), and others.  Then there is the "program auto".  I don't yet know what the difference is here.  The Panorama mode is fantastic.  The zoom is great These may be the reasons for me to keep this camera and struggle with the endless menus needed to go through to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: Major disappointment
Reviews.Author: Jane "History Buff"
Reviews.Content: This was to be a step up to more megapixels for me.  It has been such a major disappointment.  I haven't had pictures this bad in many years.  It's literally a crap shoot.  I can take a dozen pictures and get one that is the quality I consider acceptable.  I took the camera on a sunny afternoon cruise--useless, absolutely useless.  You cannot see what your picture will possibly be because of the glare on the viewing screen.  It should be called the "guess and shoot."  Distance shots suck, close-ups are difficult to get, don't even bother using it in bright light.  Well, actually it doesn't handle low light well either.The dial at the top for choosing settings moves so easily that it is constantly in the wrong setting and choices for settings are confusing and limited.  Ergonomics?  That is an area the designers apparently knew nothing about whatsoever.I didn't start using this for a while after I got it--too busy to sit down, read the manual, and play with it--or it would have been returned immediately.  (Let me add here since another person misunderstood my review that this means that I DID read the manual prior to using it.  I waited to use the camera until I had time to read the manual.  In fact with the problems, I read the manual A LOT.  My point is that I could not return camera because of the amount of time that had passed since purchase.)How sad that I get better pictures with my old 4 megapixel camera.  It's one of those things that you know you ought to just throw in the trash, but you feel guilty tossing out something that cost over $200.  Instead you stick it in a drawer and ignore it for a few years.  THEN you toss out the over $200 piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera with wonderful zoom
Reviews.Author: J. Soto
Reviews.Content: When I started looking for a new camera this one wasn't even on my radar. But when someone let me look at one I was sold. I have had fun using the panoramic feature and the Smile shot is great when trying to get one of the kids.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery management
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: I like the camera but it does not come with a dock to connect a charger to nor the USB link to the computer.  You can't use the included USB cable link to charge the battery.  You have to take the battery out of the camera and use a separate battery charger.  All that is just plain stupid.  Why not also charge the unit when it is connected to the USB?  Why not also offer a small dock that includes a link to charger and the USB link to the computer?  I had an older model Cybershot that was a good camera and had the charging/link dock.  I would not have purchased this model if I had realized that battery management is "from the 80's"  Way out of date.  Poor design.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper 720
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after much hype and the raving reviews received on it by other Amazon buyers. It does have some nifty features on it such as the panoramic sweep picture, great zoom and the face recognition is spot on. The camera speed is also pretty fast.However, where this camera fails is in picture quality. The quality is inconsistent. Outside under bright sunny conditions, the pictures come out pretty good, however indoors the picture quality is really inconsistent. Sometimes the flash washes the picture and creates a white hue and sometimes the pictures come out very grainy with soft colors. I compared this to my girlfriend's Canon 1200 and the picture quality on the Canon came out clearer and sharper sometimes.The camera is also really bulky, which I wouldnt mind as much if the picture quality was spot on, but it doesn't so no reason for it to be this big.I returned mine after using it one day. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: safe and sound!
Reviews.Author: mariel
Reviews.Content: the product came within 2 weeks and in an excellent condition.thanks!

ProductInfo.Features:
10x optical zoom Sony G-Lens (25mm-equivalent wide angle); Capture breathtaking images in Sweep Panorama Mode
14.1-megapixel CCD sensor; 3.0-inch LCD screen
HD Movie mode (720p); take stable movies while walking in Active Mode
iAuto automatically optimizes camera settings; Smile Shutter technology automatically captures a smile
Card slot for optional Memory Stick Duo media and SD media
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle Optical Zoom with SteadyShot Image Stabilization and 3.0 inch LCD (Silver)
